ratings.comment: I took Professor Dutton's SPAN 130 (Intermediate Spanish) class at UIUC. She is not only a great professor but is very caring and understanding. I was not the most proficient in Spanish, but as long as you show up to class and complete the work on time you will do fine.

I took Professor Michelle Dutton's class last year (Spring 2022). I'm very glad she was my Spanish teacher. She's a very caring, friendly, and kind teacher! I would definitely take her class again in the future!

I'm so glad I had Michelle this semester. She's kind, flexible, and genuinely cares about her students' success. She's also one of the few teachers I've had who sent out a survey about the class and actually adjusted her lectures to fit student needs. Overall, I can't say enough good things about her.
Michelle is an amazing instructor, very loving and caring. She made the class very enjoyable and entertaining. Would totally recommend, she also manages to meet with you at anytime.

Michelle was not the prof for me. This was my first Spanish class ever and I had a really hard time. This was a summer accelerated class so the work load was VERY heavy. Participation is heavily stressed. I had a difficult getting help outside of class. I tried to attend office hours and she never showed even though it was open hours.
Very friendly and caring, gives good feedback on homework and is helpful in scheduling time to meet, not a huge amount of work and this class is very writing heavy with no tests/quizzes etc

Professor Dutton is so caring and genuinely wants her students to succeed. The class consists of one homework assignment per week (answer key on Canvas), a few short "ensayos," and 3 longer writing assessments. She gives wonderful feedback on all assignments and it is a very easy A.

Professor Dutton really wants to get to know her students individually. She's so nice and understanding. She does count participation and gives weekly homework. lectures can be boring, but its grammar there's only so many ways to teach it. Overall recommend, don't be intimidated by homework load.
She is very kind and cares about her students. She is very helpful and approachable, and gives good feedback. She does grade on participation.

Professor Dutton is very kind and really cares about her students. I find her Spanish-speaking abilities inspiring. This class has pretty little homework that is not too difficult, and for a writing class, you don't have to spend too much time writing. But, I am not a fan of the lectures because they include a lot of boring activities.

Profesora Dutton is one of the sweetest professors I have had in my time at UW. She is really cares about her students and their success. While there is quite a bit of writing in 226 she helps you through it and is always willing to meet outside of class if you need help.

Michelle is GREAT! She's so friendly and approachable, and she incorporated what we liked to do into class. She gave plenty of opportunities for feedback, and the workload was not bad at all. I feel like I learned so much in this class! 10/10 would take a class with her again.

Professor Dutton is WONDERFUL! She incorporated our interests into the course material, which I thought was so sweet and made lecture more engaging. A decent amount of writing assignments, which was to be expected since it was a writing based class, but none were too hard. She gives great feedback and really wants students to succeed. Loved her!

Michelle is a great teacher - she gave excellent feedback and always answered questions very quickly. Class was online so I really appreciated her quick email responses If you have to take this class, take it with Michelle!

We didnt have to show up to every class as long as we participated enough to cover for the classes you werent going to. Very nice and cares about her students a lot. Writing very key in Spanish 226, but if you do the work and listen to her feedback you will succeed.

I absolutely loved taking this class with Michelle! She was so sweet that you could tell that generally cared about all of her students and their success in her class. She is a little nit-picky when it comes to certain grammatical errors, but she does a great job at letting you know what you need to improve on to become a better Spanish writer.

Of all my professors this semester, she had the best adjustment to online classes. A lot of writing, but this is a writing class. I think 4 1 page assignments and 3 2 page essays. She took time to give quality feedback which made my writing better. Lectures could get boring at times but not too bad. Workload isn't too bad. She was really nice.
She is the nicest and sweetest professor ever! So understanding of students needs.

i love her. i'm having personal family issues and she's more than willing to work with you and provide extensions. the class is based on progress so there aren't exams, just a few essays that are fairly easy. the weekly workload wasn't bad either!! overall awesome, i 10/10 recommend.

She is a great teacher and a fair grader! I learned a lot in the course and never felt like too much homework or material for tests. We had small online activities due most days, but they took 10 minutes, 15 at most. 1 test about every other week, but I liked this because they were manageable and the format was consistent. 3 short papers total.

Michelle was really great and I liked her a lot. I had class early in the morning so I had a hard time focusing, and near the end of the semester kind of fell off with participation, but Michelle did the best with our class who didn't participate a lot. I appreciate the time Michelle put into grading, as well as coming prepared everyday.
It's a pretty easy class but you need to participate a lot in lecture because the class sizes are tiny.

She cares a lot about your education and will always help you out as much as possible. I'm not a fan of all the small group activities we do and we have to walk a lot in class, but it's helpful and the class isn't too crazy hard.

Best Spanish teacher ever. Taught me so much compared to previous teachers!! Works with students - if we know something, she won't force us to keep practicing. If we don't, she'll answer ever question someone has. Clear criteria for tests and assignments. Few assignments, test every two weeks, but that means not a ton to study for each test!

She always tried to make the content she was teaching more interesting with different games. When she asked for feedback on her teaching style she did her best to implement it. Her test formats were clearly given before each exam and with a little studying anyone can do well. Minimum writing and oral assignments and she was so nice! 10/10 recommend

The course overall is fairly easy and Michelle is a great teacher. She is very knowledgeable and if there is ever a question that she doesn't know the answer to she always will look it up and get back to you. There is a test for each unit which ends up being about every other week, but they are straightforward and she prepares you!

Michelle is the worst teacher I have ever had; she made me want to quit Spanish. Her class was unorganized and she was unable to articulate lessons to the class. Class activities were pointless and most of her learning tools were an utter waste of time. She needs another year of observation if she continues teaching. Avoid at all costs.
